item.title: Electrical Design Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:              Electrical Design Co-op
Location:             Kitchener, Ontario              
Division:              OTTO Motors
Co-op term:         Fall 2023

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech….. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023. 

Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.

About the Job:
You’re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a young company in this high-growth market. You have skills and experience that you know can make a difference with the Clearpath team, whether we\'re looking for them or not. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of self-driving platforms and attachments
  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of power distribution and motor systems
  • Assist in the Electrical design and diagnostics of battery and charging systems and interfaces
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • Integration and testing of prototypes into fearsome robots
  • Documentation and drawing generation
  • Physical assembly and prototyping of all the cool stuff

Additional tasks may include:

  • Care, feeding, and testing of new products.
  • Evaluating and documenting emerging and current manufacturing processes
  • Supporting on-site installation and commissioning of robotics equipment at Clearpath facilities

Job Requirements:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Able to quickly grasp fundamentals of common sensors and actuators used for robotics and automation.
  • Avid self-learner.
  • Fearless in asking questions while thinking you are the only one who does not understand.
  • Enjoys documenting processes and operation plans.
  • You see block diagrams everywhere and speak the language.
  • Team player, good communicator, able to cope with sarcasm.

Bonus Points for:

  • Familiarity with Vesys, Altium, Linux, ROS, C++
  • Familiarity with unit testing, system-level testing, and continuous integration.
  • Past experience with building robots or other vehicles.
  • Experience with the control of mobile robots.
  • Experience having parts manufactured to your specifications.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Hardware Test Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:           Hardware Test Co-op
Location:          Cambridge, Ontario 
Term:                 Fall 2023 
Study Level:     Senior
Area of Study:  Mechanical / Systems / Mechatronics Engineering

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

According to US NSC statistics from 2019: 8,140 injuries were related to forklift operations. These numbers have continued to increase. By replacing manually driven forklifts with autonomous vehicles, accident rates can be reduced and lives can be saved. Even if the work you will be doing impacts those numbers by 0.1%, it means that 8 people will be going home safely at the end of their shift. To us, it matters.

About the Job

Want to break stuff? Want to do things nobody has done before? Join the Hardware Test Team at OTTO Motors! We experiment with state-of-the-art AMR technology to discover its strengths and weaknesses.

The Hardware Test Team is responsible for devising and enacting test plans that provide real actionable data that directly influences product design, configuration, and standards compliance. The team is responsible for executing system and subsystem level design validation and product reliability tests to further improve the industrial strength of our product line. You will be an integral part of a team focused on providing real data that makes a significant impact on the way design choices are made at OTTO Motors.

We will need you to always be ready to think outside the box, troubleshoot problems, and desire to apply your technical skills to break down challenges & problems, and work on them one at a time. We will need you to focus on the purpose of the tests in hand, while having the bigger picture in mind how your contributions will result in a positive impact for our engineering design and safety of our products.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Assisting in the developing and tuning of Vehicle Dynamics simulation models using multibody modeling software
  • Developing and executing validation tests for system functionality and performance targets
  • Generating test reports that concisely and accurately describe testing conditions, methods, and results
  • Continuously studying industrial AMRs; how they work, how they fail and FMEA
  • Participating in test plan reviews and contribute to the team’s testing strategy
  • Commissioning, integration & support of mock workflows at our test facility to enable testing of different sample use cases as well as project specific workflows
  • Developing and executing stress tests of subsystems to improve hardware reliability
  • Troubleshoot, repair, and report industrial robot failure
  • Comprehend and apply standards that pertain to AMR performance and testing
  • Gather and analyze data with excel, ubuntu terminal commands, bash and python scripts
  • Solving new and challenging technical problems related to all of the above

Additional responsibilities include:

  • Consulting other departments on vehicle dynamics, reliability, and how to design fruitful tests
  • Troubleshooting software & hardware issues using various internal and external tools 
  • Developing & maintaining reference documentation & tools that help improve the Hardware Test Team’s ability to test industrial robots
  • Optimizing vehicle performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation
  • Communicating technical details to the broader team;
  • Recommending new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • Work with Solidworks CAD software to design test fixtures and calculate mass properties of various test setups

Required skills & Experience:

  • Highly detail oriented individual
  • Not being afraid to challenge assumptions or the status quo
  • Strong communicator, verbal and written
  • Self-motivated and well organized
  • Interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • Planning & organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • Ability to stay focused on the overall goal; effectively analyzing the value of going down rabbit trails

Bonus Points For:

  • Prior experience in vehicle dynamics analysis and/or testing
  • Experience with Multibody modeling packages like MAPLESIM, Simspace and ADAMS
  • Experience with 3D CAD/Solidworks
  • Interest in learning and/or prior experience with component vibration and HALT/HASS testing
  • Exposure to working with Linux based OS (Operating System)
  • Authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.description:
Description

Position:          Mechanical Design & Testing Intern

Area of Study:  Mechanical/Mechatronics

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech….. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023. 

Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.

About the Job

You\'re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a young company in this high-growth market. You have skills and experience that you know can make a difference with the Clearpath team, whether we\'re looking for them or not. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Most of all, you want to be on the right side during the coming robot revolution.

Job Responsibilities:

You will support the design, verification/testing and upkeep of our robots\' mechanical systems. Your tasks could range from performing field testing of our newest generation of unmanned surface vehicle to designing structural components for an off-road ground vehicle. You may be required to take robots for walks, and are able to cope with the questioning stares of onlookers. You may be required to execute system and subsystem level design validation and product reliability tests to further improve the industrial strength of our product line.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Prototyping of new electromechanical systems.
  • Test plan development and implementation.
  • Modeling, drafting and specification of custom parts and assemblies.
  • Sourcing and qualification of new mechanical components and systems.
  • Pushing our robots to their breaking points.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Capable hands-on skills. You are able to turn a car into a boat if necessary.
  • Team player, good communicator, able to cope with sarcasm.
  • Able to cope with sudden jarring changes in projects, priorities, and the local gravity field.
  • Past experience with building robots or other vehicles which are larger than a breadbox.
  • SolidWorks modeling and drafting experience.
  • Experience having parts manufactured to your specifications.
  • Basic electrical prototyping & troubleshooting experience.

Helpful

  • Familiarity with Linux, C, Python, ROS.
  • Experience with common sensors and actuators used for robotics.
  • Experience with the control of mobile robots.
  • Machine shop experience.
  • Experience with sheet metal parts.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:        Perception Developer Co-op
Location:       Based in Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario
Duration:       Fall 2023
Study Level:     Senior
Area of Study:  Computer Science, Software Engineering or Related Field
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful and motivated candidate for the Perception Developer Co-op position. This person will help develop the next generation of perception and machine learning algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization, mapping, object detection and computer vision.

The Perception Team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Developer you will work on the development and testing of the core robotics software that drives vehicles at sites all around the world. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on robots. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Creating robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Developing custom perception and machine learning algorithms and systems related to localization, mapping, object detection and tracking, computer vision, and more
  • Evaluating new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Assisting with concept development for new products and projects
  • Supporting the deployment and testing of robotic systems

Skills and experience:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, object detection and tracking, robotic perception.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++ and Python.
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems.
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code.
  • Experience with ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch and TensorRT.
  • Familiarity with linear algebra and nonlinear optimization techniques and libraries such as Ceres, GTSAM, g2o and Eigen.

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Developer Co-op (OS Team)
item.description:
Description

Position:          Software Developer Co-op (OS Team)       
Location:          Kitchener, Ontario     
Duration:          Fall 2023
Student Level:  Junior
Area of Study:  Software Engineering/Computer Science

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech….. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023. 

Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.

About the job:

You will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team responsible for bridging the gap between the mechanical machine, the autonomy stack and the fleet manager. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from middleware software applications to very high-level server functionality.

Your primary responsibility will be to tackle hard problems and you’ll have the opportunity to show your skills in a team of highly competent developers. To be successful, you will work closely with your mentor to sharpen your C++ and Python coding knowledge and learn everything you need to know about ROS (Robot Operating System) as well. A self-driving robot is a complicated system, and you’ll need to be able to understand enough of it to figure out how to complete your tasks. You will need to be able to make progress independently as well as leverage your team’s knowledge to be most efficient. Once you have a viable solution to a problem, you’ll test and validate it on our fleet of test robots.

OTTO is a hybrid workplace, so you’ll have to be physically present in the office at least once a week.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Troubleshoot, address and validate issues.
  • Enhance existing components with new functionality.
  • Work collaboratively with a senior developer on a larger project.

Required Skills:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines independently.
  • Practical software development skills.
  • Team player, good communicator.
  • Experience with Linux.
  • Version control (Git).
  • Proficiency in C++ and Python.

Helpful:

  • Unit testing, system-level testing, and continuous integration.
  • Bash, or other scripting experience.
  • Exposure to CMake, especially in a packaging or deployment context.
  • Experience with ROS, or other robotics middleware.
  • JIRA

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Autonomy Engineer - Multi-agent Navigation
item.description:
Description

Position:            Autonomy Engineer- Multi-agent-Navigation         
Location:           Kitchener, Ontario or Remote/Virtual, Canada 
Job Type:          Full-Time, Permanent
Experience:      2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:        Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms for navigation, collaboration, and control - all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the core software for fleets of multi-ton robots, find optimal routes through the most complex work environments around the world, and safely balance millimeter tracking accuracy with maximum driving performance.

The navigation team’s primary responsibility is robotics software development, testing, and support. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve our self-driving capabilities, selecting the best research and/or industry algorithms to employ, and developing high-performance implementations that expand our core autonomy software. As part of the team, your input will be integral for reviewing and supporting the designs, implementations, and tests developed by other autonomy engineers. Finally, as part of OTTO, we work closely with both industry and academia, where you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with our partners and see your ideas making a measurable difference in the world.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Developing collaboration, navigation, and control software
  • Testing/reviewing software for reliability/performance
  • Conducting research projects to expand our capabilities
  • Supporting deployment, product, and testing teams

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaborating with academic/industry partners
  • Mentoring and assisting with supervision of interns
  • Writing research papers for academic publication
  • Explaining our newest shiny toys to sales & marketing

About You

You want to work for a company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, here to make a difference, and never satisfied with work left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and thrive on challenging, rewarding problems.

Required Technical Skills:

  • Graduate degree in engineering or a related field, with applicable background
  • Practical knowledge in two or more areas of: path planning, motion planning, mobile robot control, vehicle modelling, and multi-agent systems
  • Strong software development skills in Modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Hands-on experience with autonomous systems

Desired Soft Skills:

  • Ability to efficiently and clearly communicate ideas, including to those who may have a limited theoretical background in the area
  • Ability to reliably plan and estimate development time requirements
  • A learning mindset and positive attitude
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines, job responsibilities, and the local gravity field

Bonus points for:

  • ROS experience
  • Strong Python / Lua skills
  • Experience with the control of differential drive, bicycle, and tricycle ground vehicles
  • Understanding of sensors and their error models, particularly laser rangefinders, GPS systems, and vision systems


At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position:       DevOps Engineer
Location:      Kitchener ON
Experience:   2 to 5 years
Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
Division:       OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech….. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023. 

Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.


About the Job

The Dev Ops Team is looking for an experienced Dev Ops Engineer to help drive and maintain the developer operations experience.  The team is tasked with ensuring that the full lifecycle of development from source submission to release is fully automated, seamless and reliable.  The team handles all aspects of the development environment and workflow, including build, internal productivity tooling, automated testing platform infrastructure and deployment.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Identify areas of improvement in Development infrastructure, improve build system and tooling.
  • Manage and monitor the health of infrastructure and services within.
  • Work with the Development team towards containerizing the product.
  • Manage and provide services on AWS and build infrastructure as a code.
  • Collaborate with other teams to determine needs and gaps.
  • Participate in DevOps infrastructure support rotation.
  • Participate in Incident response, root cause analysis and fixing issues.
  • Maintain and develop DevOps toolchains and automated processes.
  • Maintain and develop the full simulation stack workflows.
  • Document DevOps processes, standards and contribute towards creating runbooks.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. You can work independently and in a collaborative environment. You have an eye for details, identifying issues and exploring probable solutions.

Required skills and experience:

  • 2+ Years experience as a hands-on DevOps/SRE.
  • Strong experience in building Infrastructure as a Code, self-serve pipelines using GitOps model.
  • Experience in developing and maintaining CI pipelines (Jenkins/Groovy/Gitlab-CI).
  • Experience in AWS, provisioning and managing AWS services.
  • Knowledge of cloud networking services like Security groups, NACLs, VPC, Transit gateway 
  • Production level experience in docker, Kubernetes  and managing K8s cluster
  • Strong experience in provisioning/orchestration using Ansible, Terraform, Helm 
  • Strong experience in building IaC and GitOps model
  • Knowledge of observability stack like Grafana, Prometheus, ELK
  • Knowledge of load balancing and configuring Nginx/HAProxy
  • General Linux OS and network troubleshooting skills
  • Python Programming or other relevant scripting language.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Knowledge of VMware or other virtualization products
  • Source Control software (Git), branching strategies and knowledge of best practices

Bonus skills:

  • Experience with NixOS
  • Experience with test infrastructure or automated test frameworks.
  • Experience working in the robotics industry or knowledge of ROS.
  • Experience with python and debian packaging 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.description:
Description

Position:                  Perception Team Lead - Localization and Mapping               
Location:                 Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:                Full-Time Permanent
Experience:            5-10 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education:              Graduate Degree in a related field
Division:                OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful, motivated candidate for the Perception Team Lead position. This person will lead a team of developers to create and maintain the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, state estimation, computer vision and more.

The localization and mapping team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception, mapping and localization on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots. As part of the perception team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

About You

For the role of Perception Team Lead we are seeking an experienced developer and leader to drive the development of state-of-the-art localization and mapping solutions for real world applications.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Lead a team of exceptional perception developers to create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, localization, computer vision, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new algorithms and sensing technology
  • Assisting with concept development for new products and projects
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Supervising and mentoring team members
  • Collaboration with internal teams including controls and navigation, as well as academic and industrial partners
  • Stay up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry

Skills and experience:

  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field
  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, localization, mapping, or sensor modeling.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
  • Excellent leadership, teamwork, and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including scope, timelines, resource estimates, and test procedures.

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience with leading software development teams.
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

item.description:
Description

Location:      Kitchener ON or Remote/Virtual-Canada
Experience:   5+ years
Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
Division:       OTTO Motors

About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology.

Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech….. and Fast Company’s 2023 list of Most Innovative Companies in 2023.

For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.   OTTO delivers intelligence, productivity, scalability, results and most importantly, the future.

.About the Job

The DevOps Team is looking for an experienced DevSecOps Engineer to be part of the team to implement Development Operations and Security initiatives. This position provides a great opportunity to implement security best practices and aligning organization’s security strategy in development and devops teams across the organization. The team is tasked with ensuring that the full lifecycle of development from source submission to release is fully automated, seamless and reliable. As a senior engineer in the DevOps team, this role will collaborate with the rest of the team to handle all aspects of the development environment and workflow; build, automated testing platform infrastructure and deployment.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Drive initiatives to secure product, internal infrastructure & productivity tooling.
  • Work within the DevOps team to integrate security tools and automate security workflows  into CI pipeline.
  • Contribute to tool evaluation, selection and recommendation to the organization.
  • Provide security advisories to various stakeholders (Engineering, Product etc.).
  • Guide and support the engineering teams in the use of the DevSecOps infrastructure, tools and secure developmental practices.
  • Conduct assessment of applications using a range of manual and automated penetration testing and source code review techniques.
  • Collaborate in developing, improving, and managing security controls, monitoring, incident response practices and ensure compliance with security standards.
  • Delegate, schedule and manage tasks within the DevOps Domain (Sprint and Long-term).
  • Collaborate with other teams to determine needs and gaps.
  • Be an ambassador for security initiatives to ensure that all teams are producing a highly secure product.  
  • Maintain and develop DevOps toolchains and automated processes.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. 

Required skills and experience:

  • Minimum 5 Years experience as a DevOps with significant part of it in security operations.
  • Must have prior experience in SAST/DAST/SCA tools and integrating them into CI/CD pipelines.
  • Strong experience in scripting languages like Python, Bash etc.
  • Knowledge of orchestration tools like Ansible, Terraform and Kubernetes.
  • Strong experience in pen-testing and using popular OPSWAT pen testing tools.
  • Experience with compliance frameworks like SOC and PCI Data security standards.
  • Working knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, Helm or other container management products.
  • Knowledge of AWS services and implementing security controls on AWS.
  • Strong understanding of Linux/Ubuntu based environments.
  • Knowledge of using VMware or other virtualization products.
  • Maintaining and developing pipelines using CI tools like (Jenkins, groovy).
  • Source Control software (Git) and knowledge of best practices.
  • Experience automating workflows or providing DevOps toolchains.
  • Ability to work remotely.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Bonus skills:

  • CISSP/CDP or any DevSecOps-related certification a big plus
  • Experience with NixOS
  • Experience with packaging tools like debian/apt

item.title: Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors
item.description:
Description

Position:        Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors
Location:        Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario
Job Type:       Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     3+ Years Relevant Work or Academic Experience
Education:     Graduate Degree in Related Field
Division:        OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a driven, resourceful and motivated candidate for the Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors position. This person will take a leading role in the development of calibration and sensor algorithms for autonomous mobile robots.

The Perception Team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, you will develop and maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration and monitoring of robotic systems. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators, as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on robots. As part of the Perception Team you will continue to advance the cutting edge of robotics research through collaboration with our academic partners and contributions to research publications and open source initiatives.

About You

For the role of Senior Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors, we are seeking an experienced developer to develop, support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for real world applications.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Creating robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Developing custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluating new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Working with production and hardware teams to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Supporting the deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Collaborating with various internal teams, as well as academic and industrial partners
  • Staying up to the date with the latest developments from academia and industry

Skills and experience:

  • Graduate degree in engineering/CS or a related field, with applicable background.
  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration.
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models.
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++.
  • Understanding of software development workflows, life cycles and development methodologies and tools.
  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems.

Bonus points for:

  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code.
  • Experience with ROS, Gazebo, OpenCV and PCL.
  • Familiarity with linear algebra and nonlinear optimization  techniques and libraries such as Ceres, GTSAM, g2o and Eigen.
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Staff Software Developer (Fleet Manager)
item.description:
Description

Position:         Staff Software Developer (Fleet Manager)
Location:        Kitchener, Ontario
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent       
Experience:   8+ Years of relevant Software Development related experience
Education:     Post-Secondary degree or diploma in Computer Systems Technology or related field
Division:       OTTO Motors 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are looking for a Staff Software Developer to work on the Fleet Core team as part of the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development, and support.

Reliable robot hardware needs reliable software, including Fleet Management. We are looking for a Staff Software Developer who can bring experienced software development experience and leadership to help us define, implement and deliver innovative solutions for our customers.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Solve technical problems of the highest scope and complexity for your team.
  • Advocate for improvements to product quality, and performance that have particular impact across your team and others.
  • Actively seek out difficult impediments to our efficiency as a team ("technical debt"), propose and implement solutions that will enable the entire team to iterate faster.
  • Drive innovation on the team with a willingness to experiment and to boldly confront problems of immense complexity and scope.
  • Exert significant influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of your team. 
  • Contribute to and extend documentation and materials to empower users of our Fleet Management solutions.
  • Provide mentorship for all members in the team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
  • Confidently ship large features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the teams outside of the Fleet Group on larger projects.

About You

You want to work for a fast-paced company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. As a Staff Software Developer you have delivered and supported software deployed for customers on the other side of the world. You know the ins and outs of the Software Development Life Cycle and strive to automate whatever you can along the way. You keep on top of the latest technologies and are not satisfied with “because we always did it that way”. You’re also an excellent communicator and team player with demonstrated leadership skills. You can clearly explain the merits of a solution to other developers and managers. You’ve got a real knack for coming up with solutions that make (and keep) people happy.

Required Experience/Skills

  • Post-secondary diploma in Software Development or related field
  • 8+ years Software Development experience
  • Strong Object Oriented Programming experience (Python, C++)
  • Strong bash or other shell scripting languages
  • Experience developing software with data persistence layer (SQL)
  • SCM experience (git, Gitlab, Github, Bitbucket, SVN, etc.)
  • Experience with ticket and content management systems (JIRA, Confluence, etc.) 
  • Experience clearly and concisely communicating complex technical and architectural problems and proposing iterative solutions (LucidChart, Visio, etc.)

Bonus Skills

  • Experience developing ROS applications
  • Experience working with container frameworks (Kubernetes, Docker, etc.)
  • Experience with database object relational mapping libraries (Django, etc.)
  • Experience with CMake, make or other software build solutions
  • Experience with Nix package management
  • Debian based Linux skills - package management and configuration
  • Experience with data analytics and presentation tools (Grafana/Prometheus, Kibana/Elastic, etc.)
  • Experience configuring or deploying web based applications
  • Postgres or other database administration and/or integration experience

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Test Developer (Developer Relations)
item.description:
Description

Position:            Test Developer (Developer Relations)
Location:           Kitchener, Ontario    
Job Type:           Full-Time Permanent          
Experience:       2-5 Years
Education:        College Diploma, with 2-5 years\' work experience in ME/EE/SW or Testing 
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a Test Developer to join our Developer Relations team to test and validate our robots as we integrate our software solution for Autonomous Navigation onto more vehicles to create new Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs).  You will take charge of test plan development and execution for various products and custom projects, to ensure that our hardware and software is co-existing harmoniously. This will range from designing test campaigns to identify and eliminate issues early on, through to tail end validation focused on detailed product verification. Your goal is to increase efficiency and reliability with regards to product testing and validation. You will work closely with the rest of the Clearpath development team to make sure that we are delivering properly engineered solutions. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Executing test for full system, component, simulation, and performance
  • Designing test campaigns
  • Documenting test results
  • Capturing issues and artifacts, establishing strong feedback loop back into development

Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing simulations, maintaining and extending testing standards and best practices
  • Testing and validating product components used in projects
  • Determining or helping to drive test requirements for new products, components, or projects as required
  • Supporting CI and internal tools and infrastructure
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure 
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution
  • Occasional travel to partner facility and remote support for testing

About You

You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. You are resourceful and enjoy working hands-on with both hardware and software. You have a passion for quality; you are never satisfied with a job half done or releasing a product that is not up to your highest standards.

Your programming background is strong and you’re able to diagnose issues faster than the speed of light. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day. 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • College Diploma in a relevant technical field
  • 2-5 years’ working in mechanical, electrical, software design or testing environments (or Post Graduates with similar exposure)
  • Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with testing validation of complex integrated systems and/or software
  • Experience with Linux / Unix operating systems including scripting languages (e.g. bash, shell, awk etc.)
  • Hands on experience with software/hardware mixed products, which may utilize motor controls, machine controls, and various sensory components in combination with software
  • Strong verbal and written communications
  • Ability to work well independently, as well as in a team environment

Bonus Experience/skills:

  • Combination of experience designing, implementing, maintaining or executing technical acceptance plans
  • Python or similar Object Oriented programming experience (C++, Java, Javascript, Ruby, etc.)
  • Git or similar version control experience (BitBucket, Github, etc.)
  • Understanding of continuous integration concepts and tools (e.g. Jenkins, BuildBot, etc.), and best practices
  • Familiarity with defect tracking systems such as JIRA
  • Experience with analysis with tools like iPython Notebook, Matlab or others

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863
